Art History Read More »

The post Art History appeared first on BehindKaysEye.
item.content:encoded:
Art encompasses diverse media like painting, sculpture, printmaking, drawing, decorative arts, photography, and installation. Visual arts exist in ranges from purely aesthetic purposes at one end to purely functional purposes is reflected in the term artist and artisan, understood as one who gives considerable attention to the function. 

In cultures such as Africa and Oceania, this definition of art has existed for centuries. In the West the development of academies for painting and sculpture established a sense that these media were art so they separated from more functional media. In the 20th century the definition of art was being questioned. This occurred when Dada artist Marcel Duchamp submitted a porcelain urinal title Fountain to a public exhibit in New York City. Through this movement he put together a new definition of what constitutes as a work of art. He suggested that it’s enough for an artist to define something as art and display it publicly. This made it challenging for museums, exhibiting groups, and galleries that get to determine what is and is not considered art. This continued throughout the 20th century in moments such as conceptual art and minimalism. By the 21st century a variety of new media further challenged the original definition of art. 

The definition of art has drastically changed over time and will likely continue to change in the future. The fundamental reasons that art is made, looked at and though about have never changed though no one knows what those reasons really are. The industrialization of the art world is a essential social and financial phenomenon.
